item.title: 欧洲陷入困境的汽车行业计划关闭工厂和裁员
item.description: 由于需求疲软、生产成本高昂、中国竞争对手的竞争以及电动汽车转型速度低于预期，欧洲多家汽车公司最近宣布关闭工厂并大幅裁员。【原文：A slew of automotive companies have recently announced plant closures and big layoffs in Europe as they struggle with weak demand, high production costs, competition from Chinese rivals and slower-than-expected electric vehicle transition.】

item.title: 西班牙 11 月制造业采购经理人指数显示洪水导致制造业增长放缓
item.description: 周一的一项调查显示，受东部沿海瓦伦西亚地区严重洪灾的影响，西班牙制造业在11月份的扩张速度有所放缓，但对未来增长的信心依然强劲。【原文：Spain's manufacturing sector expanded at a slower pace in November, hindered by the severe floods in the region of Valencia on the eastern coast, a survey showed on Monday, though confidence in future growth remained robust.】

item.title: 首席执行官塔瓦雷斯辞职后，Stellantis 下跌 3-6
item.description: 在米兰上市的 Stellantis 公司首席执行官卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯（Carlos Tavares）周日突然辞职后，该公司股票周一开盘大幅下跌。【原文：Milan-listed shares in Stellantis were seen opening sharply down on Monday after chief executive Carlos Tavares resigned abruptly on Sunday.】

item.title: 马来西亚敦促中国企业避免利用马来西亚逃避美国关税
item.description: 马来西亚贸易部副部长周一表示，马来西亚已敦促中国公司不要将马来西亚作为 "重新命名 "产品以规避美国关税的基地，因为马来西亚的出口限制越来越多，而且人们对中美贸易战感到担忧。【原文：Malaysia has urged Chinese companies to refrain from using it as a base to "rebadge" products to avoid U.S. tariffs, its deputy trade minister said on Monday, amid increasing export restrictions and concerns of a U.S.-China trade war.】

item.title: 土耳其 11 月制造业 PMI 显示复苏迹象
item.description: 周一的一项商业调查显示，土耳其 11 月份的工厂活动连续第八个月萎缩，产出和新订单均有所放缓，尽管该行业出现了复苏迹象。【原文：Turkish factory activity contracted for the eighth month in a row in November with output and new orders moderating, although the sector showed signs of recovery, a business survey showed on Monday.】

item.title: 意大利的税收制度是如何为富人操纵的？
item.description: 一项新的研究显示，意大利的税收制度存在偏差，社会最富有的 7% 人口所缴纳的税款比例低于中低收入者，这加剧了不平等，损害了这个欧洲负债最多国家之一的公共财政。【原文：Italy's tax system is skewed in a way that lets society's wealthiest 7% pay proportionately less tax than low and middle-income earners, a new study shows, fuelling inequality and hurting public finances in one of Europe's most indebted nations.】

item.title: 阿达尼电力公司称没有迹象表明孟加拉国会审查电力交易
item.description: 阿达尼电力公司（Adani Power）周一表示，没有迹象表明孟加拉国政府正在审查与该公司签订的购电协议，而此前一天，路透社报道称该国正在寻求重新谈判该协议。【原文：Adani Power on Monday said it has no indication that the Bangladesh government is reviewing a power purchase agreement with the company, a day after Reuters reported that the country is looking to renegotiate the deal.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：欧洲央行行长莱恩表示，该行在决策时应关注未来风险
item.description: 欧洲央行首席经济学家菲利普-莱恩（Philip Lane）周一在接受《金融时报》采访时表示，欧洲央行未来的货币政策决策应基于即将到来的风险，而不是最新的经济数据。【原文：The European Central Bank should make future monetary policy decisions based on upcoming risk rather than the latest economic data, ECB chief economist Philip Lane told the Financial Times in an interview published on Monday.】

item.title: 据 FD 报道，联合利华首席执行官希望出售销售额达 10 亿美元的食品品牌
item.description: 联合利华首席执行官海因-舒马赫（Hein Schumacher）在周一出版的荷兰金融日报《FD》上接受采访时表示，联合利华正在寻求出售几个食品品牌，这些品牌的总销售额约为 10 亿欧元（10.5 亿美元）。【原文：Unilever is looking to sell several food brands that have combined sales of around 1 billion euros ($1.05 billion), Chief Executive Officer Hein Schumacher told Dutch financial daily FD in an interview published on Monday.】

item.title: 独家报道俄罗斯 VTB 预计 2025 年利润为 4000 亿卢布
item.description: 俄罗斯第二大银行 VTB 首席执行官安德烈-科斯汀（Andrei Kostin）在接受路透社采访时表示，受央行紧缩货币政策的影响，VTB 预计 2025 年的利润将从今年的 5500 亿卢布下降到明年的 4000 亿卢布（37.6 亿美元）。【原文：Russia's second largest lender VTB expects 2025 profit to be 400 billion roubles ($3.76 billion) next year, down from 550 billion this year, due to the central bank's tight monetary policy, VTB's CEO Andrei Kostin told Reuters in an interview.】

item.title: 独家报道俄罗斯 VTB 首席执行官称卢布将稳定在 100 美元/美元左右
item.description: 俄罗斯第二大贷款机构 VTB 银行首席执行官安德烈-科斯汀（Andrei Kostin）周一告诉路透社，在美国对俄罗斯金融业实施制裁后的波动期过后，俄罗斯卢布将稳定在 1 美元兑 100 卢布左右的水平。【原文：The Russian rouble will stabilise at around 100 to the U.S. dollar after the period of volatility in the aftermath of U.S. sanctions on Russia's financial sector, CEO of Russia's second largest lender Bank VTB Andrei Kostin told Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 独家报道俄罗斯 VTB 银行预计西方制裁不会很快解除
item.description: 俄罗斯第二大银行 VTB 首席执行官安德烈-科斯汀（Andrei Kostin）在接受路透社采访时表示，西方不会很快解除因俄罗斯在乌克兰的军事行动而对其实施的制裁。【原文：Western sanctions imposed on Russia over its military action in Ukraine will not be lifted anytime soon, the CEO of Russia's second largest lender VTB Andrei Kostin told Reuters in an interview.】

item.title: 早间竞标特朗普改变对强势美元的看法
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole】

item.title: 劳资纠纷升级，大众九家工厂将举行罢工
item.description: IG Metall 工会表示，由于劳资双方就大众汽车德国业务的未来发生冲突，大众汽车德国九家汽车和零部件工厂的工人将于周一举行数小时的罢工，导致装配线停工。【原文：Workers at nine Volkswagen car and component plants across Germany will strike for several hours on Monday, IG Metall union said, bringing assembly lines to a halt as labour and management clash over the future of the carmaker's German operations.】

item.title: 独家报道美国对中国芯片的最新打击波及半导体工具制造商
item.description: 本周一，美国将对中国半导体行业发起三年来的第三次打压，限制对 140 家公司的出口。【原文：The US will launch its third crackdown in three years on China's semiconductor industry on Monday, restricting exports to 140 companies.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Kioxia 确定的首次公开募股价格区间为每股 1,390-1,520 日元
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的人士称，贝恩资本支持的芯片制造商 Kioxia 已将首次公开发行股票的价格暂定为每股 1,390 至 1,520 日元（9.22 至 10.09 美元）。【原文：Bain Capital-backed chipmaker Kioxia has set a tentative price range of 1,390 to 1,520 yen ($9.22 to $10.09) per share for its initial public offering, two people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 独家报道联合国呼吁投资 2.6 万亿美元扭转土地退化趋势
item.description: 每天所需的约 10 亿美元中，很大一部分需要来自私营部门。【原文：A large chunk of the around $1 billion a day that is required will need to come from the private sector.】

item.title: 中国经济复苏带动亚洲工厂回暖，但特朗普风险隐现
item.description: 亚洲最大的制造业经济体在 11 月份加强了活动，其中中国工厂的复苏在一定程度上受到了中国政府刺激政策和出口热潮的推动，但该地区其他地方的疲软状况也显示出一些挑战。【原文：Asia's largest manufacturing economies stepped up activity in November, with China's factories extending their recovery driven in part by Beijing's stimulus and a rush to export, though weak patches in other parts of the region pointed to some challenges.】

item.title: 华尔街创纪录后亚洲股市上涨；美元反弹
item.description: 在对美国利率前景至关重要的一周里，美元兑日元和英镑从多周低点反弹。【原文：Asian stocks climbed on Monday, buoyed by record high closes on Wall Street, while the dollar bounced back from multiweek lows against the yen and British pound in a crucial week for the U.S. interest rate outlook.】

item.title: 新加坡中央银行就关系经理不当行为对摩根大通罚款 180 万美元
item.description: 新加坡央行周一表示，对美国贷款机构摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase）处以 240 万新元（179 万美元）的民事罚款，原因是该公司未能预防和发现其客户关系经理的不当行为。【原文：Singapore's central bank on Monday said it fined U.S. lender JPMorgan Chase a civil penalty of S$2.4 million ($1.79 million) for failing to prevent and detect misconduct committed by its relationship managers.】

item.title: 澳大利亚拟议法律将就数字竞争问题对大科技公司处以罚款
item.description: 澳大利亚周一提议制定一项法律，如果全球科技公司压制竞争并阻止消费者在不同服务之间进行转换，则可对这些公司处以最高 5000 万澳元（3300 万美元）的罚款。【原文：Australia proposed a law on Monday that could impose fines of up to A$50 million ($33 million) on global technology companies if they suppress competition and prevent consumers from switching between services.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行称非银行贷款机构风险有限
item.description: 澳大利亚央行周一表示，非银行贷款人参与证券化的风险有限，因为劳动力市场依然具有活力，为家庭和企业提供了支持，而且该行业的整体规模依然较小。【原文：Australia's central bank said on Monday that risks from non-bank lenders in securitisation are limited as the labour market remained resilient, supporting households and businesses, and the size of the sector remains small overall.】

item.title: 财新PMI显示，中国11月工厂活动增速创5个月新高
item.description: 周一的一项私营部门调查显示，由于新订单（包括来自国外的订单）带动生产稳健增长，11月份中国工厂活动以五个月来最快的速度扩张，推动制造商的乐观程度达到八个月来的最高点。【原文：China's factory activity expanded at the fastest pace in five months in November as new orders, including those from abroad, led to a solid rise in production, pushing manufacturers' optimism degree to an eight-month high, a private-sector survey showed on Monday.】

item.title: 分析师下调评级后，阿达尼的主要投资者 GQG 股价下跌 13
item.description: 在阿达尼集团（Adani Group）被起诉后，瑞银（UBS）分析师下调了该公司的股票评级，并估计该公司可能损失 6 亿澳元（3.9 亿美元）的管理资金，此后澳大利亚上市公司 GQG Partners 的股价周一下跌了 13%。【原文：Shares of Australian-listed GQG Partners fell 13% on Monday after UBS analysts downgraded the stock and estimated the firm could have lost A$600 million ($390 million) in funds under management following the Adani Group indictment.】

item.title: 澳大利亚任命特斯拉主席登霍尔姆领导研发绩效审查工作
item.description: 澳大利亚周一任命特斯拉主席罗宾-登霍尔姆（Robyn Denholm）领导对该国研发绩效的审查工作，以提高经济增长。【原文：Australia appointed Tesla chair Robyn Denholm on Monday to lead a review of the country's research and development performance, in an attempt to improve economic growth.】

item.title: 中国数据向好，以色列-黎巴嫩停火局势动荡，石油价格上扬
item.description: 受世界第二大石油消费国中国工厂活动向好的支撑，以及以色列不顾停火协议恢复对黎巴嫩的袭击，加剧了中东地区的紧张局势，周一油价有所上扬。【原文：Oil prices edged up on Monday supported by upbeat factory activity in the world's second largest oil consumer China and as Israel resumed attacks on Lebanon despite a ceasefire agreement, stoking tensions in the Middle East.】

item.title: 美元在利率和政治不确定性中走高
item.description: 周一，美元悄然走高，本周对于美国降息前景而言至关重要，而日元近期的反弹则是受到了国内利率上升赌注的支撑。【原文：The dollar crept higher on Monday in what is shaping up to be a critical week for the prospect of U.S. rate cuts, while the yen's recent rebound was underpinned by wagers on rising rates at home.】

item.title: 澳大利亚零售业在提前打折中加快增长步伐
item.description: 澳大利亚 10 月份的零售额增幅超过了预期，原因是减税政策已渗透到工资总额中，而且消费者对利率不会再次上调也更有信心，尽管宽松货币政策看起来仍然遥遥无期。【原文：Australian retail sales rose by more than expected in October as tax cuts flowed through to wage packets and consumers became more confident that interest rates would not increase again, although monetary easing still looked distant.】

item.title: 美元面临美国利率紧缩周，日元保持涨势
item.description: 周一，美元走势谨慎，因为本周对美国降息前景而言至关重要，而日元近期的反弹则受到了国内利率上升赌注的支撑。【原文：The dollar started in a cautious mood on Monday in what is shaping up to be a critical week for the prospect of U.S. rate cuts, while the yen's recent rebound was underpinned by wagers on rising rates at home.】

item.title: 智库斯德哥尔摩国际和平研究所（SIPRI）称，世界百强防务集团 2023 年武器销售额增长 4
item.description: 一家领先的智囊团周一表示，受战争和地区紧张局势的推动，全球最大的100家国防设备制造商在2023年的武器销售额将增长4.2%，达到6320亿美元。【原文：The world's 100 biggest defence equipment makers increased their arms sales by 4.2% in 2023 to $632 billion, fuelled by wars and regional tensions, a leading think-tank said on Monday.】
